modules.description: Implements the HOTP algorithm for generating and verifying one-time passwords sent via trusted third-party channels like email. Works with Base-32 encoded secrets, numeric code sequences, and counter values to produce time-independent tokens. Use to build server-side 2FA flows where the server controls token generation and verification against a stored counter state.

Generates and verifies time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) using a Base-32 secret. It supports configurable time windows, digit lengths, and HMAC hash algorithms (SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-512). Used in authenticator apps and password managers for user-controlled token generation and verification.

This module implements core cryptographic operations for generating and validating one-time passwords (OTPs), including HMAC generation, base32 decoding, and string padding. It handles string-based secret keys, timestamps, and binary data manipulation, supporting both HOTP and TOTP algorithms. Use it to generate secure OTPs, decode base32-encoded secrets, or validate time-based tokens with configurable drift and padding.

This module implements the HOTP and TOTP algorithms for two-step verification, providing functions to generate and verify one-time passwords. It works with Base-32 encoded secrets, timestamps, counters, and HMAC-SHA1, SHA-256, and SHA-512 hash algorithms. Use it to integrate 2FA into authentication systems, implement server-side token validation, or build custom OTP verification flows with support for time-based or counter-based tokens.
